channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Zelenskyy accuses Russia of trying to sabotage peace talks with ‘typical Russian lies’
item.description: Russia’s claim it foiled drone attack on Putin residence shows ‘they do not want to finish this war’, Ukrainian president says Volodymyr Zelenskyy has...

item.title: Trump floats hopes of Gaza peace progress as Netanyahu begins visit
item.description: US president says Hamas disarming could prompt new phase of peace plan ‘very quickly’, while Netanyahu still seeks return of final hostage body US pol...

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene says she was ‘naive’ for believing Trump is man of the people
item.description: Greene gives lengthy interview with New York Times days before stepping down as congresswoman for Georgia Marjorie Taylor Greene, now just days away f...

item.title: Claudia Winkleman to host new BBC chatshow
item.description: Strictly and Traitors presenter and ‘true national treasure’ will front The Claudia Winkleman Show from spring She has ruled the Traitors castle and w...

item.title: US pledges $2bn in new UN model for delivery of humanitarian assistance
item.description: Gaza not covered in announcement and will be handled on separate track, says US state department official The United States on Monday pledged $2bn in ...

item.title: Anthony Joshua injured in fatal Nigeria car crash
item.description: The British heavyweight boxer suffered minor injuries in the crash which killed two people, near Lagos.

item.title: Why Israel's recognition of Somaliland as an independent state is controversial
item.description: Somaliland wants international recognition - here's why, and what could have driven Israel to recognise it now.

item.title: Beyoncé declared a billionaire by Forbes
item.description: The star joins Taylor Swift, Rihanna, Bruce Springsteen and her husband Jay-Z with 10-figure fortunes.

item.title: Claudia Winkleman to host new chat show on BBC One
item.description: It will be produced by So Television, which is also behind Graham Norton's award-winning chat show.

item.title: Government to review 'information failures' in British-Egyptian activist case
item.description: Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper says she and Sir Keir Starmer were unaware of Alaa Abd El Fattah's "abhorrent" historical tweets.
